items.message: Areas most at risk include low lying areas in Tetbury, Badminton, Brook End at Luckington, Corsham, Lacock and the road at Reybridge. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Bristol Avon, Tetbury Avon, Sherston Avon, Dauntsey Brook, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected. Further rainfall is forecast tomorrow Friday 05/12/25 and over the weekend. River levels will remain high over the coming days in response to this forecast rainfall.

items.description: River Trent from Cromwell Weir to Gainsborough
items.message:
River levels have fallen at the Torksey gauge but will rise at the next high tide this evening.  Consequently, the risk of flooding of roads and farmland remains.
Areas most at risk are Church Laneham to Rampton Road. Rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours. 
River levels will rise again after tonights tide from 20:30 on 04/12/2025.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses . 

This message will be updated by 17:00PM on 04 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Churn, Hilcot Brook, Daglingworth Stream, Gumstool Brook

items.message:
High river levels may lead to flooding. 

Flooding is possible from the morning of the 04 Dec 2025.

Flooding of low lying land and roads is possible today, along the River Churn around Cerney Wick. The weather forecast is for further rain which could be heavy at times over the next 3 days. We expect river levels to fall slowly.

We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 19:00 04 Dec 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Evenlode from Moreton in Marsh to Cassington and also the River Glyme at Wootton and Woodstock
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Further rainfall is forecast but no further flooding is expected.  
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.  
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals.

items.description: River Thames and its small tributaries from Calcutt to Lechlade

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Thames, Blunsdon Brook, Water Eaton Brook, Marston Meysey Brook, Share Ditch, Bydemill Brook, Westrop Brook, Downington Brook

items.message:
High river levels may lead to flooding. 

Flooding is possible from the morning of the 04 Dec 2025.

Flooding of low lying land and roads is possible today, 04 Dec 2025, along the River Thames, especially in the Kempsford area. This is as a result of rivers responding to recent rainfall. The weather forecast is for further rain which could be heavy at times over the next 3 days. We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days.

We are closely monitoring the situation.

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 19:00 04 Dec 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: South East Somerset Rivers, Upper Reaches

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Yeo, River Cam, River Wriggle, Barwick Stream, West Coker Stream

items.message: River levels are still falling very gradually, but remain high at Sherborne Lake, above the Alert level. Further rain overnight tonight into Thursday morning, 04/12/2025, will keep this level high and will likely cause other local rivers to rise again, including the River Yeo, River Wriggle and River Cam. Flooding of low-lying land and roads is possible in this area, including around the Sparkford to Weston Bampfylde road and Deep Ford Lane, Chetnole. Therefore the need for this Alert remains. Further heavy rain is expected on Friday 05/12/2025 into Saturday. We are closely monitoring the situation, and checking defences, bridges, debris screens and culverts. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 13:00PM on 04/12/2025, or as the situation changes.

River levels are falling slowly but remain high and the potential for flooding continues today, 4 December 2025. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from Wolverley to Newport. Other locations that may be affected include Market Drayton, Wem, and Rodington. We are closely monitoring the situation . Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 5 December 2025 or as the situation changes

River levels are rising again at the Stinsford river gauge on the Lower Frome after overnight rainfall. Flooding is forecast to affect low lying areas to start with near to the River Frome in the Dorchester, West Stafford, Bockhampton, Lewell, Tincleton, Pallington, Waddock, Moreton, Wool, East Stoke, Holmebridge, Stoborough, Stoborough Green, Wareham, Redcliffe, Ridge and Swineham areas. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this Flood Alert if necessary. Please avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. People in this area should take action now and watch your local weather forecast. This message will be updated by 09:00 AM on 5/12/2025, or as the situation changes.

Rising river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 04 December 2025 following heavy rain overnight. 
Flooding is forecast to affect areas near the River Isle and River Parrett, with low lying land and roads affected, particularly at Ashford Mill, Isle Brewers, Fivehead, the Norton sub Hambdon to Stratton road, the A356 and the B3165 at Chiselborough and the B3168 at Ilford Bridges. The lower River Parrett is forecast to be bankfull and overtopping could occur. After a drier day today, further heavy rain is forecast throughout much of Friday, 05/12/2025 and early Saturday. This will cause rivers to rise again, re-triggering this alert and further flooding later on Friday and Saturday. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . We are clearing blockages from debris screens, bridges and culverts. 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . Start acting on your flood plan if you have one. 
This message will be updated by 7:00PM on 04 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels remain high but steady at the Lugwardine river gauge. Flooding continues today 4 December 2025. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the River Lugg south of Leominster from Stoke Prior to Mordiford. Other locations that may be affected include Bodenham, Lugwardine and Hampton Bishop. We are closely monitoring the situation . Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 05 December 2025 or as the situation changes

items.description: River Yeo and River Parrett Moors around Muchelney and Thorney
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Further rainfall is forecast but no further flooding is expected. Further rain is forecast tonight into Thursday morning, 04/12/2025. This is not expected to trigger this alert again in the next 24 hours. 
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.  
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car. Please note there may still be flood water in fields and open land.

floodArea.county: Bath and North East Somerset, Wiltshire

items.message: This flood alert remains in place. Areas most at risk include low lying land and roads between Melksham and Bathford. The flood gates at Holt Road may be closed. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Bristol Avon, Semington Brook, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected. Further rain is forecast tomorrow Friday 05/12/25 and over the weekend so river levels will stay high and the flood risk remains.

items.description: Rivers Clyst and Culm and their tributaries
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
High river levels today and tomorrow may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible overnight from 03 December 2025.
 
Forecast levels may cause flooding to low lying land and roads close to the rivers. The main areas of concern are Cullompton, Willand, Culmstock, Hemyock, Bradninch, Broadclyst and Clyst St Mary.
We expect river levels to respond to additional rainfall over the next few days. 
We are closely monitoring the situation. 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. 
This message will be updated by 4:00PM on 04 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels are currently rising due to rainfall, flooding may continue over the next few days. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the River Severn from Tewkesbury to Gloucester. Locations that may be affected include Apperley, Maisemore, Hempstead, Minsterworth Ham and Quedgeley. The Severn Ham, Tewkesbury may start to fill.

Predicted peaks:-
Mythe 3.1m to 3.7m 06/12/2025 AM.
Haw Bridge 4.2m to 4.7m 07/12/2025 PM.

Tides are increasing from Wednesday until the weekend. River levels at Sandhurst and Gloucester will be influenced by these tides. Current predictions:

Sandhurst 2.9m to 3.1m 03/12/2025 PM and 3.0m to 3.2m 04/12/2025 AM.
Gloucester 2.5m to 2.8m 03/12/2025 PM and 2.8m to 3.1m 04/12/2025 AM.

Additional rainfall is forecast Friday onwards, which may cause river levels to rise further.

We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.

This message will be updated by 09:00AM on 5 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.message:
High river levels overnight may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the evening of 03 December 2025 overnight and into Thursday. 
A band of rain is expected on Wednesday evening. Forecast levels may cause flooding to low lying land and roads close to the rivers.
The main areas of concern are Seaton, Colyton, Axminster and Axmouth.
We expect river levels to remain high overnight and into tomorrow, though no flooding to properties is currently forecast. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 
This message will be updated by 4:00PM on 04 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Forecast levels may cause flooding to low lying land and roads close to the river.  

We expect the river to remain high overnight and into tomorrow, though no flooding to properties is currently forecast.   

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels.   

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.   

This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 05 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message: With dry weather today, river levels have fallen on most rivers in West Somerset, but remain high on the Washford River. Further rainfall overnight tonight and into tomorrow morning, Thursday 04/12/2025, will keep the Washford River at Alert level, and will cause the other rivers to rise again. There is a risk of flooding tomorrow, Thursday. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers including the Horner Water, Rivers Aller, Washford River and the Hawkcombe, Monksilver and Doniford Streams and tributaries. We continue to monitor rainfall and river levels. This message will be updated by 13:00PM on 04/12/2025, or as the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
High river levels may lead to flooding.  

Flooding is possible on Friday 05 December. 

A band of rain is expected on Friday.  

Forecast river levels may cause flooding to low lying land and roads close to the river. 

The main areas of concern are Yealmpton, Yealmbridge and Mill Bridge. 

We expect the river to remain high overnight on Friday, though no flooding to properties is currently forecast.  

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels.  

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  

This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 05 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

High tides today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 16:00 to 21:00 on 04 December 2025. 
High tides, strong winds and large waves may lead to overtopping. Locations most affected will be coastal roads and footpaths. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid beaches and coastal promenades, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 9:00PM on 04 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels remain high and the potential for flooding remains today 04 December 2025 . Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from the Welsh border at Llawnt to Shrawardine near Shrewsbury. Other locations that may be affected include Llanymynech, Maesbrook and Melverley. Roads between Maesbrook, Melverley and Pentre start to flood. Peaks:- Cae Howel 4.4m to 4.5m on 04/12 AM. We are closely monitoring the situation . Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 05 December 2025 or as the situation changes

High tides today may lead to flooding.

High tides, strong winds and large waves may lead to overtopping. Locations most affected will be coastal roads and footpaths. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid beaches and coastal promenades, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 9:00PM on 04 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Severn estuary from Gloucester to Sharpness
items.message:
Higher than normal tides this evening may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 8:30pm on Thursday evening and 9:00am on Friday morning. 
Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the Estuary from Sandhurst to Chepstow and Sharpness over the next 5 days. Some lengths of the flood embankment at Longney and The Noards may be overtopped. Rodley Lane, Westbury and Awre Road, Brims Pill may be flooded. 

Predicted peaks: 
Thursday evening 04/12; Gloucester 3.1m to 3.4m at 8:30PM, Sandhurst 3.2m to 3.5m at 9:00pm. 

Friday morning 05/12; Gloucester 3.2m to 3.5m at 9:00AM, Sandhurst 3.4m to 3.7m at 9:15pm. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Monitor local water levels and weather conditions . 
This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 05 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Dee catchment in England from Whitchurch to Chester
items.message:
River levels are due to remain high for the next few days.

Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Dee. Flooding is possible at low lying land and roads around the River Dee at Shocklach, Farndon, Handley, Lower Kinnerton, Chester and Puddington.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels.

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.

This message will be updated by 16:00PM on 04 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels are currently rising due to rainfall, subsequently flooding may continue over the next few days. Flooding may affect low lying land & roads adjacent to the river from Highley to Tewkesbury; including Dog Lane Bewdley, Stourport, Diglis & Hylton Road towpath. Flooded drains may affect the racecourse & Worcester CCG. PLP should be installed. New Street gate is closed at Upton upon Severn.   

Predicted peaks:- 

Bewdley 2.9m to 3.2 m 04/12/2025 PM. 
Worcester 3.3m to 4.0m 05/12/2025 AM. 
Diglis 2.8m to 3.5m 05/12/2025 AM. 
Kempsey Yacht Club 4.9m to 5.6m 05/12/25 AM. 
Saxons Lode 4.0m to 4.6m 05/12/25 PM. 

Additional rainfall is forecast on Friday and into the weekend, which may cause river levels to rise further. 

We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  Consider the installation of property flood resilience measures 

This message will be updated by 09:00AM on 5 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels are currently rising due to rainfall, subsequently flooding may continue over the next few days. Flooding may affect low lying land and Squires Walk in the area of the Hatfield Brook Kempsey.  

Kempsey Flood Alleviation Scheme may become operational from 05/12/2025 AM. 

Predicted peak:-  
Kempsey Yacht Club 4.9m to 5.6m 05/12/25 AM. 

Additional rainfall is forecast on Friday and into the weekend, which may cause river levels to rise further. We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.   

This message will be updated by 09:00AM on 5 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Due to recent rainfall, river levels remain high but are falling. Further rainfall is forecast today and over the next few days. Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Willington, Barrow upon Trent, Swarkestone, Bargate Lane and the access roads to Willington Meadows, the Twyford Village access road, Church Lane at Barrow, and Ingleby Lane. River levels at Willington Gauge and Shardlow Gauge will continue to fall through this morning 04/12/2025, but will then rise again from this afternoon 04/12/25 into the following days. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 9:00PM on 04 December 2025, or as the situation changes.
